page.title: 13Transport To Gourdon
page.content: People are dependent on buses, taxis or private cars for transport, the area being no longer served by a railway. An hourly{bus service}between Aberdeen and Montrose is operated with some buses coming down into the village itself. A bus is also provided to take secondary pupils to the Mackie Academy in Stonehaven. The Montrose to Inverbervie rail link which served Gourdon was opened in the 1860's and operated for just over 100 years, being finally closed down in 1966. The former track provides a pleasant coastal pathway to either Inverbervie or Johnshaven. The former line also provides BMX racing bike enthusiasts with a ready made track for this currently popular activity.
